alert.note: Alert for Graham; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 11 at 3:07AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM FRIDAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow is expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two to three inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 21 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below to 40 below zero. * WHERE...Norton and Graham Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM Friday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Most of the expected cold wind chill readings for the Advisory/Warning periods will occur at night, but will linger into the daytime hours each day. Coldest readings will occur Saturday night into Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
